column2: In the year 1979 IC, The Grand Theogonist of Sigmar refused to affirm [This.GetTitledName] claim to the Imperial Throne. This ended the tradition of elected Emperors which caused strife across The Empire.\n\nWhile Count [This.GetFirstName] seeks to resolve this wrong and push [This.GetHerHis] rightful claim to the Imperial Throne, reports are coming in that dark Rituals are happening in Sylvania.

In the year 1979 IC, The Grand Theogonist of Sigmar rightfully refused to affirm Countess Magritta of Westerland as the next Emperor. This unjust coronation attempt ended the tradition of elected Emperors which caused strife across The Empire.\n\nWhile Count [This.GetFirstName] seeks to resolve this wrong and push [This.GetHerHis] rightful claim to the Imperial Throne, reports are coming in that dark Rituals are happening in Sylvania.
The Empire is mine, by right.

Hail! [This.GetTitledNameWithNick], known across the Old World for your never-ending sadistic pleasures.
With each person sacrificed to the Prince of Pleasure, you take another step towards daemonic divinity.

From the depths of your fortress on the Isle of Gaman, your path of conquest begins.
Cleanse the Beastmen filth from these lands so that you may one day settle them with your own people.
In the ultimate display of devotion, sacrifice yourself to lower the strength of the Winds of Chaos.
Convert this county to your current capital.

The King of the Trolls, also once known as Wintertooth, is among the most unnaturally intelligent of his vile kind, intent on bringing the world under the rule of a new ice age with himself at its head.
Republics exercise their influence via trade.\nAt their head, powerful families feud in a\nbitter struggle for leadership.
column3: Les Républiques marchandes exercent leur influence par le commerce. A leur tête on trouve de puissantes familles qui rivalisent pour le pouvoir.

column2: This is the Chronicle of House [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName], in which is contained the record of its yearly fortunes, glories and difficulties.
column3: Voici les chroniques de la maison [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName], qui relatent la gloire, la fortune et les mésaventures des années passées.
column4: Dies ist die Chronik des Hauses [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName], in der die Glücksfälle, der Ruhm und die Schwierigkeiten jeden Jahres verzeichnet sind.
column6: Esta es la Crónica de la Casa de [GetOnlyDynastyName], la cual contiene el registro de sus fortunas anuales, sus glorias y sus dificultades.

column2: This is the Chronicle of House [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName], in which is contained the record of its yearly fortunes, glories and difficulties.
column3: Allons-donc, voilà la leçon d'histoire, en tant que précepteur, je me dois de vous assurer une éducation parfaite. Vous ais-je déjà dit que j'avais été Chroniqueur au service de la Famille [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] ? Nul besoin de vous parler de leurs réussites commerciales, néanmoins connaître leur histoire ne peut que vous aidez à améliorer et chercher à devenir aussi grands qu'eux. Commençons par les faits qui se sont déroulés sous le règne de [From.GetTitledName].
column4: Dies ist die Chronik des Hauses [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName], in der die Glücksfälle, der Ruhm und die Schwierigkeiten jeden Jahres verzeichnet sind.
column6: Esta es la Crónica de la Casa de [GetOnlyDynastyName], la cual contiene el registro de sus fortunas anuales, sus glorias y sus dificultades.

column2: This is the Chronicle of House [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName], in which is contained the record of its yearly fortunes, glories and difficulties.
column3: Voici les chroniques de la maison [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName], qui relatent la gloire, la fortune et les mésaventures des années passées.
column4: Dies ist die Chronik des Hauses [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName], in der die Glücksfälle, der Ruhm und die Schwierigkeiten jeden Jahres verzeichnet sind.
column6: Esta es la Crónica de la Casa de [GetOnlyDynastyName], la cual contiene el registro de sus fortunas anuales, sus glorias y sus dificultades.

column2: This is the Chronicle of House [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName], in which is contained the record of its yearly fortunes, glories and difficulties.
column3: Au nom d'Allah, le tout puissant, le miséricordieux, loué soit-il, c'est à moi scribe de la noble maison [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] qu'il appartient de relater ici les hauts faits, fortune et revers de cette glorieuse dynastie, puisse-t-elle perdurer à jamais ! \nC'est au cours du règne de [From.GetTitledName] que commence cette épopée.
column4: Dies ist die Chronik des Hauses [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName], in der die Glücksfälle, der Ruhm und die Schwierigkeiten jeden Jahres verzeichnet sind.
column6: Esta es la Crónica de la Casa de [GetOnlyDynastyName], la cual contiene el registro de sus fortunas anuales, sus glorias y sus dificultades.

column2: This is the Chronicle of House [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName], in which is contained the record of its yearly fortunes, glories and difficulties.
column3: Voici les chroniques de la maison [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName], qui relatent la gloire, la fortune et les mésaventures des années passées.
column4: Dies ist die Chronik des Hauses [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName], in der die Glücksfälle, der Ruhm und die Schwierigkeiten jeden Jahres verzeichnet sind.
column6: Esta es la Crónica de la Casa de [GetOnlyDynastyName], la cual contiene el registro de sus fortunas anuales, sus glorias y sus dificultades.

column2: An Amazon Queen should be fierce and ruthless. A weak leader can only lead to trouble.
Your Queen is weak, so she must be replaced. Whether she still has some fire to fight for her crown or not, this ultimatum will just be a formality.
By tradition, Athel Loren is held by the conjoined rule of two divine Avatars of the Elven Gods Isha and Kurnous, yet the Elf currently claiming the throne has not received such blessing.
There is no avatar of Kurnous to lead the Asrai to their glorious Wild Hunts. Without him, Athel Loren is weakened and his inhabitants restless.
There is no avatar of Isha to protect the sacred glades of Athel Loren. Without her, the great forest is weakened and his inhabitants restless.
The gods have abandoned Athel Loren. Without them to protect and lead them, the Asrai fear for their very survival.
This ruler has not shown proper reverence for the mysterious denizens of Athel Loren.

It is common in Ulthuan for Elves to preach detachment from the rest of the world, to prevent corruption from pouring in. Going against this traditional way of thinking is not well regarded by some Princes.
Ulthuan should not meddle with other lesser cultures. It is time for the Phoenix King to accept that.
Some in Ulthuan agree it is the sacred duty of the Asur, as the superior race, to act as guardians and protectors to the lesser races, and keep the world safe from corruption.
Ulthuan should not cower away from the world, hopelessly leaving the other races to their own limited means. It is time for the Phoenix King to accept that.

Your many connections amongst the refined Asuryan aristocracy allow you to organize a meeting between you and a fellow Asur, an invitation too polite and prestigious to refuse, after which, you will be able to put your skills of orator to good use and see if you can come to some arrangement with [Root.GetTitledFirstName].\n\n Once you've met with the other ruler, you shall be able to discuss matters of marriage, favors and gifts.

Isolationist elves can use their connections and considerable prestige to press one of their friends into conceding them a favor.\n Be wary your relationship with [From.GetFirstName] and the traits of both will determine whether [From.GetSheHe]'ll decide to concede your plea or not.

Invest to send [Root.GetFirstName] to the illustrious court of the Phoenix King. If the monarch of all Ulthuan accepts [From.GetHerHim], [Root.GetSheHe] will be part of the most exclusive place in Asuryan society, talk with some of the greatest Princes in Ulthuan and be part of the great political clockwork that is the Phoenix Throne.\n If the Phoenix King owes you a favor, that will make it much more likely for [Root.GetFirstName] to be accepted, but it will remove said standing favor as well.
Tradition states the Phoenix Crown to be wore by a man, whereas the Queen takes the spiritual leadership of Avelorn as Everqueen. Going against such a tradition is not well thought of.
Tradition states Avelorn to be held by the Everqueen. Going against such a tradition is not well thought of.

Since time immemorial, Ulthuan has been governed by the conjoined rule of a Phoenix King and an Everqueen, to be arrogant enough to claim absolute dominion over the Asur is cause for great outrage amongst High Elves.
This King has not yet tested himself passing through the flames of Asuryan. Until he submits himself to this trial, his claim to rulership remains dubious amongst the other Princes.
This Asur has not yet made clear is stance over the possible involvement of Ulthuan in external affairs.
Create a new colony from any land held by yourself or vassals outside of Ulthuan.
I am no longer living on Ulthuan, it is time to embrace our new way of life.
I am no longer living outside Ulthuan, it is time to act like a true lord of Ulthuan.
To ease the administrative burden on the Phoenix Court your liege has decided to organise your realm into a new unified colony ruled by yourself.
To ease the administrative burden on the Phoenix Court your liege has decided to organise your realm into a new unified colony ruled by [NewColonyRuler.GetTitledFirstName].

To ease the administrative burden on the Phoenix Court your liege has decided to organise all land outside of Ulthuan in the realm into a new unified colony ruled by [NewColonyRuler.GetTitledFirstName].

To ease the administrative burden on the Phoenix Court you have decided to organise all land outside of Ulthuan you have come into possession of into a new unified colony ruled by [NewColonyRuler.GetTitledFirstName].
You will be compensated for land given away.
As part of your decision to reorganise your foreign holdings into a new colony you must pick a leader from among the nobility already present.
Your opponent charges back at you.
Final clash that will determine the winner
Let all Knights and Lords of the region be invited
column3: Permettez à tous les Chevaliers et Seigneurs de la région d'être invités.
column6: Permite que todos los caballeros y Lords de la región sean invitados

column2: Let all local Knights and Lords be invited
column3: Permettez à tous les Chevaliers et Seigneurs des environs d'être invités.
column6: Permite que todos los caballeros y Lords locales sean invitados

column2: No competing tourneys elsewhere in the realm are in progress\n
column3: Aucun tournoi autre part dans le royaume n'est en cours.\n

column2: Has NOT held a tourney in the past 10 years\n
column3: N'a PAS organisé de tournoi dans les dix dernières années\n

column2: Is NOT currently attending another tournament\n
column3: N'est PAS actuellement en attente d'un autre tournoi\n

column2: This great warrior has been blessed by Khorne with inhuman strength and an insatiable thirst for blood, making them a terrible opponent on any field of battle.

This character has ascended past the boundaries of mortality. The Lord of Skulls has deemed them worthy of the greatest honour and made them an immortal engine of violence and destruction, to forever fight in his name.
Offer this character a place in your hammerer bodyguard. Only the best of the best are allowed to join this elite bodyguard and you think this character may be one of them...
One for me, one for Pa...
All Clan [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] Grudges against [From.GetBestName] will be settled

[Root.GetBestName] will become a Slayer. [FromFrom.GetSheHe] will forsake all possessions and titles, forever wandering the world seeking honourable death by fighting uneven battles against impossible foes.\n

[Root.GetBestName] will be known as Unbaraki, an oathbreaker. Dwarf society will openly disdain [FromFrom.GetHerHim], and other Dwarf rulers will be able to launch wars to depose [FromFrom.GetHerHim] and cast [FromFrom.GetHerHim] down.\n
A throng is mustered in defense of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName].\n
column3: Vous faites appel à une bande de fervents guerriers.\n
column4: Ihr ruft eine Gruppe ergebener Krieger herbei.\n
column6: Llamas a una banda de guerrero devotos.

column2: Hashut will surely grant you His favour by sacrificing this lesser [Root.Culture.GetName] in His great furnaces...
You can sell [Root.GetTitledFirstName] in the slave markets of [From.Capital.GetName] for an appropriate sum...

Start the rituals to be granted the greatest gift from the Father of Darkness, mastery over the magic arts. Hashut is not a generous deity, and you'll need to offer Him a great number of sacrifices and start a great ceremony in hopes of being seen as worthy of this gift by the Bullfather...
Hashut, the Father of Darkness, is known to grant generous gifts to those who show Him proper respect and keep His furnaces flowing with sacrifices...
Recently asked Hashut for a boon
This character has been blessed with the Infernal Fire of Hashut. As a consequence his body is now stronger, and his mind more cunning.
This province's forges and factories have been blessed with the Molten Rock of Hashut, and now can produce goods at a faster rate.
The slaves of this province have witnessed what becomes of those who fail the Dawi Zharr, and are working hard to avoid being offered to the fires of Hashut.

The Chaos Dwarfs are known to trade the armaments they produce on their factories with the Chaos worshippers of the Northern Wastes and the Greenskins, in exchange for gold or slaves.\n You'll get the choice to buy either weapons and armours for your warriors, or a contingent of Doomcannons from [Root.GetTitledFirstName].
This character has recently bought armaments from the Dwarfs, and can't buy again until 10 years have passed
This character has recently bought armaments from the Chaos Dwarfs, and can't buy again until 10 years have passed
This Chaos Dwarf has recently sold armaments, and can't sell again until 5 years have passed
This Dwarf has recently sold armaments, and can't sell again until 5 years have passed
The warriors of this province are armed with the best equipment from the factories and forges of the Dawi Zharr.
A regiment of Doomcannons arrives in [Root.Capital.GetName]
I will soar on wings of fire and smoke!
A cunning beast, the Lammasu may only be mounted by those chosen by Hashut!
A host of Chaos Dwarfs has laid waste to this province and taken most of its population as slaves.
A host of Chaos Dwarfs has laid waste to this province.

The Chaos Dwarfs are known to trade the armaments they produce on their factories with the Chaos worshippers of the Northern Wastes and the Greenskins, in exchange for gold or slaves.\n [Root.GetTitledFirstName] will get the choice to buy either weapons and armours for your warriors, or a contingent of Doomcannons from us.
Some courtiers residing in [From.GetName] will be sacrificed to Hashut.

This character has committed sacrilege against the Father of Darkness by forgoing to feed any sacrifices to the furnaces of Hashut for too long. An offering must be made to the Bullfather soon, or this character will face the disdain of its peers.
This character has earned the ire of Hashut by providing an unworthy sacrifice.
Raise the icon. Load the furnaces. The Father of Darkness will have His spoils today, that we may be blessed tomorrow...

The K'daai Zharr - Scions of Fire - are Hashut's servants. Forged from the raging blood and metal of the Bullfather's sacrifice pits, the K'daai are half-daemon and half-raging fire, an elemental force of destruction few mortals can hope to survive.
Though Hashut has fewer daemons aligned to him than the greater Chaos gods, they're still powerful entities, made to enslave and destroy all those who oppose him.
You will challenge [Root.GetBestName] to a duel. If you win, the Weak Warboss modifier will be removed from you.
Greenskins don't get levies or taxes fron any non-Tribal holding.
With the preparations complete, your Liche Priests stand ready to begin the rituals that will awaken a new batch of servants in your province. Of course, this will cost you some prestige...

After passing of the dreaded [former_captain.GetBestName], the First mate [designated_heir.	] has already seized all of the functions as the Lord Captain of [designated_heir.GetPrimaryTitles], it was utterly disgraceful to hear of this change of events, as by right they should be all yours, but the men aboard [designated_heir.GetHersHis] ship's have already sworn fealty to the new Pirate Lord...
I actually Prefer it this way...
Of all the useless tail-kissing liars incompetently stumbling around me, you are the one I like the most-most!

This mysterious Clan has eyes and ears everywhere and its deadly operatives are scattered throughout the Under-Empire as well as secreted about within the cities and settlements of the surface dwellers. For the right price, the black-clad agents of Clan Eshin will steal any information, commit any act of ruthless sabotage or assassinate any rival with ruthless efficiency.
Chaos is weak in the world and all its followers find themselves fending for themselves.
Chaos is strong in the world and all its followers find themselves empowered.
Chaos is very strong in the world and all its followers find themselves greatly empowered.
The ruler of this province has ordered many armaments from the Dawi, boosting fighting capability of the troops present.
